content.question: Let <math alttext="R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the region in the first quadrant bounded by the <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>- and <math alttext="y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-axes, the horizontal line <math alttext="y equals 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the graph of <math alttext="y equals, the square root of x, end root, minus 1" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><msqrt><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msqrt><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></math>, as shown in the figure above. What is the volume of the solid generated when region <math alttext="R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is revolved about the <math alttext="y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-axis?

topic.text: 8.9: Volume with Disc Method - Revolving Around the x- or y-Axis

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Apply an appropriate mathematical definition, theorem, or test.
